meanings.definition: A color resembling the blue of the sky.
meanings.sent1: The aquatone of the painting reminded me of a clear summer sky.
meanings.sent2: The artist used aquatone to capture the serene blue hue of the sky.
meanings.sent3: The aquatone of the ocean in the picture made me wish I was swimming.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with an aquatone that mirrored the vastness of the sky.
meanings.sent5: The aquatone of the dress was so vivid, it felt like wearing the sky itself.

meanings.definition: A method of reproducing colors in printing using a single ink.
meanings.sent1: The printer used aquatone to simplify the color printing process.
meanings.sent2: Aquatone is an efficient technique for achieving various shades with one ink.
meanings.sent3: The artist accidentally spilled aquatone ink, creating a colorful mess.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity knew no bounds as she experimented with aquatone in her prints.
meanings.sent5: The aquatone method revolutionized the way colors were reproduced in printing.
